subject: ENGLISH
text: Read the following passage through, and then answer the questions that follow it:

subject: ENGLISH
text: State briefly and in your own words the different interpretations of human history presented in the above passage.

subject: ENGLISH
text: i) Which of these interpretations should be rejected and on what grounds?

subject: ENGLISH
text: ii) Which interpretation does the author seem to prefer? What argument and what illustrations does he adduce in support of his view?

subject: ENGLISH
text: Explain clearly the following phrases, as used in the passage: chequered by defeat, in obedience to a periodic law, a seeker after ideals, uncritical optimism, persistent sweep.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Give the meaning and, if you can, the derivation of any five of the following words: uniformly, sequence, capricious, rational, negation, pessimism, anarchy, discernible, Hellenism, reflective.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Make a general analysis into clauses of the sentence "Man, who is above all find it."

subject: ENGLISH
text: What is the source of the metaphors in: march of human history, seeds of dissolution, cyclical revolution?

subject: ENGLISH
text: Without omitting any of the words or changing their order, arrange the following passage in verse-form, add the proper stops and name the metre.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Re-write the following in correct English, giving a reason for each correction.
